;;At 13:29 on April 2, 2023, Jikun, Jiangyuan District, Baishan City, Jilin Province Mining Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Jikun Coal Mine;) +290m east of Shimen South Wing, a large gas explosion accident occurred on the second floor of the fourth uphill coal mining face, causing 4 deaths and 4 injuries (another 4 people Physical discomfort, recovered after receiving oxygen), direct economic loss of 10.16 million yuan.

;

;After the accident, Jikun Coal Mine failed to report the accident as required, illegally transshipping and cremating the remains of the victims, and sealing off the accident site to conceal the accident. After receiving reports from the masses, when the Baishan City Emergency Management Bureau and the Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau went to the coal mine to verify the reported cases from April 3 to 12, 2023, the mine still failed to report truthfully. On April 13th and 14th, four people including the mine investor and mine manager surrendered under pressure. The accident was verified to be true by the Baishan Municipal People's Government.

;

;Recently, the Jilin Bureau of the National Mine Safety Supervision Bureau released the accident investigation report.

;

;;;How the accident occurred;;

;

;During the day shift on April 2, 2023, mine manager Li Yonghai organized a pre-shift work meeting. Li Yanping, deputy director of production, Lu Wanping, chief engineer, and Li Shichen, technical consultant, assigned production tasks to each team. After the meeting, Yang Licheng, captain of the third mining team, assigned production tasks for the shift to Wang Hongchang, the squad leader of the accident squad.

;

;Wang Hongchang’s team has 13 people on duty and 1 tile inspector. Wang Hongchang arranged for Leng Jun, Ji Yaomin, Zhang Chengxue and Zhang Qinglong to set off cannons and produce coal at Sanshang Mountain. He, Wang Junfu and Sun Cheng set off cannons and produce coal at Sishang Mountain, Li Junsheng and Guo Wensheng built wood stacks for reinforcement at Wushang Mountain, and Yang Lianpeng and Gao Cai installed equipment in the main alley. Cars, Huang Fujun and Zhang Yongsheng are responsible for pulling coal. Lu Xiang is responsible for checking the gas.

;

;The workers entered the well from the abandoned heating tunnel at about 8:00, and picked up their own miner's lamps from the "Miner's Lamp Supermarket" there. They did not carry personnel identification cards and self-rescuers, and arrived at their respective operations at about 8:15. Place. At around 10 o'clock, in order to solve the ventilation problem at the Wushangshan working face, the ventilation team leader Guan Yanlin led three workers to move the local ventilator between Sishangshan and Wushangshan at +290m East Shimen back 20 meters and move it away from the wind The bifurcation of the cylinder connects the air duct to Wushangshan. This local ventilator supplies air to the three working surfaces of Sanshangshan, Sishangshan and Wushangshan at the same time.

;

;At around 13:30, Ji Yaomin and others who were working on Sanshang Mountain suddenly saw a puff of black smoke and the wind stopped. They felt difficulty breathing and could not see anything. Zhang Qinglong and Zhang Chengxue took the lead to escape. Ji Yaomin and Leng Jun took the tools and then ran outside. When they ran to Sanshang Pass, they found that there was wind in the alleyway. At this time, Zhang Qinglong and Zhang Chengxue were lying on the ground and lost consciousness. They immediately performed cardiopulmonary resuscitation and rescued them. About 5 minutes later, The two woke up.

;

;At this time, Liu Tiezhu, the project manager who was walking to the entrance of the central water pump room at +290m, felt a large fluctuation in the wind flow, and saw a lot of dust in the wind flow in the direction of Dongyi Shimen, so he went After checking, they saw the injured Lu Xiang, Gao Cai and Guo Wensheng respectively (Gao Cai and Guo Wensheng were seriously burned), and heard Leng Jun's voice at Mikami Pass, and then returned and took Lu Xiang to the +290m water pump room, and Call the dispatch office to report the incident.

;

;;;Accident rescue process;;

;

;After receiving the accident report, dispatcher Meng Fanjun reported the accident to mine director Li Yonghai. Yonghai immediately reported the situation to mine investor Wang Haoming and legal representative Cong Peifu, and arranged for Li Tao and Huo Jianguo to organize personnel to go down the mine to carry out rescue. The rescuers met Lu Xiang, Zhang Chengxue, Ji Yaomin, Guo Wensheng, Huang Fujun and Zhang Yong and other survivors, and sent people to escort them to the well. At the same time, a person (Yang Lianpeng) was found buried in coal at the fan switch, with only one leg exposed. He was confirmed dead at the scene.

;

;The rescuers found a fall at the Sishang Pass. They checked that the carbon monoxide concentration on the inside of the Sishang Pass was 999ppm (portable multi-function detector range 0~999ppm), the gas concentration was 0.1%, and the oxygen concentration was 5%. All people on the mountain were believed to have died, and the search for rescuers continued. When we arrived at Sanshang Pass, coal fell and blocked the tunnel. We found 4 people calling for help in Sanshang Mountain. We immediately cleared the coal and entered Sanshang Mountain to rescue the seriously injured Gao Cai and Li Junsheng. Then we lifted out Zhang Qinglong, who could not stand on his right leg, and finally Rescue Leng Jun and escort him to the surface. At 18:10, all survivors had reached the ground and were sent to hospitals for treatment.

;

;At 18:40, rescue workers began to clear the pile of coal where Yang Lianpeng died, and pulled out the body and transported it to the ground. Then the carbon monoxide was discharged section by section up the mountain. When the discharge reached 13 meters from the mountain pass, the deceased Wang Hongchang was found. The gas continued to be discharged, and the victims Wang Junfu and Sun Cheng were found about 1 meter below the shelter. So far, all the bodies of the victims have been found and transported to the ground.

;

;;;Direct reasons;;

;

;+290m East Shimensi Mountain is connected to the +355m goaf area, and gas surges in the goaf area out; one local ventilator was used to supply air to three working locations at the same time. The air volume was insufficient, causing gas accumulation, and the workers fired cannons in violation of regulations, leading to accidents.

;

;;;The accident concealment process;;

;

;After the accident, Wang Haoming, the investor and actual controller of Jikun Coal Mine, arranged for the mine manager Li Yonghai organized the rescue on his own without reporting to the emergency department; arranged for Wang Zhenshan and Wang Weidong to treat the injured and the aftermath of the deceased; arranged for Cong Peifu to assist the mine manager in handling the accident.

;

;Wang Weidong sent four seriously injured people to the Hunjiang District Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital, and then transferred them to the First Affiliated Hospital of Jilin University in Changchun City. Four workers who felt unwell were sent to Tonghua City Hospital for inhalation. Oxygen therapy. Wang Zhenshan sent the four victims to the Jiangyuan District Cemetery Funeral Home, Jiangyuan District Ni Tai Hospital, Sanchazi Forestry Bureau Hospital Morgue, and Textile Factory Funeral Home, and reached a compensation agreement with the families of the victims. Subsequently, he purchased two "Medical Certificates of Resident Death (Presumption)" (hereinafter referred to as "Death Certificates") from Wang Yonghai, director of the textile factory funeral home, for 50,000 yuan each, resulting in the illegal disposal of the remains of the two deceased persons. At the same time, Wang Zhenshan arranged for personnel to delete video surveillance data related to the accident on the afternoon of April 5, deliberately concealing the accident.

;

;At around 2:00 on April 3, after the on-site rescue work was completed, Li Yonghai arranged for Guan Yanlin to lead the ventilation team members into the well, and at the original sealed position of +290m East Shimen and +355m return air alley. Construct a "quick seal" to seal the accident scene.

;

;Concealing the verification process

;

;Since 23:00 on April 2, Baishan City Emergency Management Bureau, Jilin Provincial Emergency Management Department, and Provincial Party Committee Inspection Team have successively received reports about the Jikun Coal Mine accident. report. On April 3, the Baishan City Emergency Management Bureau took the lead in setting up a joint verification team with the Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau to verify the reported cases, inspected the safety monitoring system, personnel location monitoring system and video surveillance system, and conducted a review of the April 2 incident. During the day shift, 52 people working in the well were questioned and collected evidence. As of April 13, the inspection team found no signs of a gas accident in Jikun Coal Mine, and evidence collection from those who entered the mine on duty showed that no accident occurred in Jikun Coal Mine.

;

;On the morning of April 13, in accordance with the spirit of the Baishan Municipal Party Committee meeting on April 12, the relevant leaders of the Baishan City and Jiangyuan District governments took the lead and organized the Public Security Bureau, Emergency Management Bureau and other departments to establish a joint verification team. , conduct in-depth verification of reported matters. At 18:00 on April 13, Jikun Coal Mine Director Li Yonghai, legal representative Cong Peifu, and Deputy Mine Safety Manager Li Tao surrendered to the Jiangyuan District Public Security Bureau with the consent of investor Wang Haoming under pressure from the investigation, admitting that gas occurred underground in Jikun Coal Mine. The accident resulted in 4 deaths and 4 injuries. On April 14, investor Wang Haoming surrendered to the Jiangyuan District Public Security Bureau.

;

;After investigation and verification, the Baishan Municipal People's Government Office's "Explanation on the "4·2" Gas Accident of Jikun Mining Co., Ltd., Jiangyuan District, Baishan City" confirmed: at about 14:00 on April 2, 2023 , a gas accident occurred in Jikun Coal Mine, resulting in 4 deaths and 4 injuries. After on-site inspection by the mine rescue team of Tonghua Mining Group Company, the hidden area was sealed and comprehensively searched, and no other casualties were found.

;

;;;36 people were held accountable: ;;

;

;The accident investigation report put forward accountability and handling suggestions for 36 relevant responsible personnel. . Among them, 12 people were recommended to be transferred to judicial authorities for processing:

;

;10 people including the manager of Jikun Coal Mine, legal representative, investor (actual controller), chief engineer, and the outpatient department of Jiangyuan District Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital A total of 12 suspected criminals, including the director and the director of the Jiangyuan District Textile Factory Funeral Home, were transferred to the judicial authorities for investigation and investigation.

;

;;;Eight people were recommended to be given administrative penalties: ;;

;

;Jikun Coal Mine Project Department Manager, Deputy Manager, and Deputy Safety Manager Eight people including the engineer, deputy chief engineer of mechanical and electrical engineering and director of the dispatching office were respectively imposed administrative penalties and had their professional qualifications revoked.

;

;;;15 people were recommended to be held accountable for party and government discipline: ;;

;

;The employment contracts of three mine safety supervisors were terminated and Ordered not to engage in coal mine safety production work within the administrative area of ​​Jilin Province.

;

;The director of the Wangou Town Safety Supervision Branch of the Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau was given a one-year party probation and was removed from office.

;

;The person in charge of the second office of the Coal Supervision Section of the Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau was given a serious demerit penalty and removed from office.

;

;Criticize and educate the executive deputy director of Jiangyuan District People’s Government.

;

;To the deputy director in charge and captain of the law enforcement detachment of Baishan City Emergency Management Bureau, the former party secretary and director and deputy director in charge of Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau, the party committee secretary, town mayor and deputy town mayor of Wangou Town and Nine public officials, including the president and vice president of Jiangyuan District Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine, were given party disciplinary and government sanctions.

;

;;;Jikun Coal Mine was fined and closed;;

;

;A total of 5 million was fined for concealing the occurrence of a major accident in Jikun Coal Mine and concealing the report. A fine of RMB 10,000 was included in the joint punishment targets;

;

;Jikun Coal Mine did not obtain a safety production license and illegally produced coal outside the scope of technical transformation design. It was an illegal coal mine and its illegal gains and mined coal and mining were confiscated. equipment, and be fined and requested to the Baishan Municipal People's Government to close it down in accordance with the law.

;On October 31, 2023, on Julu Road in Shanghai, a young man cosplayed White Snake and Fa Hai. (Visual China/Photo)

;

;Halloween has passed, but the "Ten Thousand Stem Festival" has not. This large-scale carnival still has lingering warmth in the metropolis of Shanghai.

;

;November 1st every year is the traditional Western festival of Halloween. The most lively moment is on Halloween, when children dress up as various cute ghosts, knock on doors and do trick-or-treating.

;

;Halloween in Shanghai in 2023 comes earlier. Starting from October 28, the city switches to the magical side. Major theme parks and some Internet celebrity bars will hold Halloween activities, as well as spontaneous street parties. Monsters and monsters of different shapes appeared on the street. What is unexpected is that Internet memes with a strong Chinese style have suddenly emerged and become popular all over the Internet. They are dubbed as a new trend of "Renaissance".

;

;When the lanterns come on, an ordinary old street can turn into a movable feast. It will be a fairy tale world where you can cosplay various characters and experience another identity; it can be a channel to release stress and express yourself; it can also be a traffic pool full of temptations. The cosplayers in the pool are eye-catching enough, and there are precedents for Xiti’s hot search lists on major platforms, which means that traffic and money will have the opportunity to be included in the bag.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters interviewed more than a dozen "crazy citizens". According to them, Shanghai has not been this lively for a long time.

;

;;

;

;On October 30, the Julu Road area was crowded with people. (Visual China/Photo)

;

;"Pure happiness" on Julu Road

;

;After leaving the subway station, the flow of people under the bright yellow lights was surging in one direction. Even without navigation, you can determine the general direction of Julu Road. The closer you get there, the denser the crowds will be.

;

;The location with the strongest Halloween atmosphere is Julu Road in Huangpu District, Shanghai. This is a commercial street named after the giant cruise ship "Julu" of the French Post Line. There are many exotic and Western-style shops. Historical buildings spread across this prosperous area. The most iconic one is the Sunken Plaza at No. 158 Julu Road, which has always been the most popular place to visit on Halloween.

;

;On the evening of October 31st, the night in Shanghai was getting darker and the carnival began. There is Tathagata Buddha riding a shared bicycle inadvertently passing by, exuding golden light; there is a zombie bride and the fire ghost king who are all dressed in red; there is also Lu Xun in a long robe, lamenting that studying medicine cannot save the Chinese people ; Pretending to be a potted plant, acting out a famous painting, or even raising a middle finger in a headband can create a bizarre landscape... The journey from Julu Road to Fuxing Park, less than 1 kilometer away, is packed with people.

;

;The level of crowding made police nervous. The entrance to Julu Road has been blocked by police with iron railings, and blue and red police lights are flashing everywhere. While maintaining order, the traffic police repeatedly emphasized: "I am not a cosplayer."

;

;Even the fence could not stop the enthusiastic flow of people. They took a shortcut from the nearby green slope about ten meters and sneaked into Julu road. Southern Weekend reporters followed the flow of people up the slope. Looking from above, Julu Road looked like a colorful light strip. The crowds of people almost filled the entire space on the road and flowed slowly.

;

;The adjacent Chengdu South Road disperses some of the flow of people overflowing from Julu Road. Relatively speaking, this place is a lot ordinary. There are two or three-story private houses on both sides of the road, full of clothing stores, leather bag stalls, taverns and fly restaurants. A restaurant owner sitting on the street is surrounded by a crowd of people. "Normally there are not many people here." Here, from last Saturday until now, there are many people in the store."

;

;If you take a few steps, you will see large and small black and white impermanences. They hold long red tongues. On their black and white high hats are written "Peace in the world" and "Wealth at first sight". , including many children wearing thick black eye shadow and looking cute. At the corner, I met the White Snake and Fahai living in harmony. The masked men from the popular Korean drama "Squid Game" stood in a row against the wall and obediently cooperated with tourists to take photos. It had nothing to do with horror.

;

;The most eye-catching people at the scene were the boys cosplaying Batman. They were tall and tall, with black masks covering their eyes, clear mandibles and indifferent expressions. From time to time, girls around him would scream, "So handsome."

;

;The Batmans have been touring twice, always causing commotion at the scene. Their trump card is to take off their tight tops and expose their porcelain chest muscles if they disagree. Circle after circle of people gathered around to cheer. The tourists on the outside couldn't see it. They just stood on tiptoe and pointed their raised mobile phones towards the center to take pictures.

;

;Within only three seconds, the Batmans were pushed out of the crowd by the police, and there was a burst of laughter from the crowd. This is a routine operation to maintain order on Halloween. People and "ghosts" causing congestion will be taken away by the police and moved to another place to ease the flow of people.

;

;;

;

;Batman hunk. Photo by Li Zixuan

;

;A God of Wealth holding a gold ingot was undoubtedly respected. There was a long queue of tourists taking photos. Some people clasped their hands and bowed their heads in worship to the God of Wealth, begging her to bless them with good fortune. For about half an hour, the God of Wealth was blocked and did not move a step. The gold ingot was touched here and there. Every time he wanted to leave, he was pulled back by the person who took the photo.

;

;The faces of the elderly also appeared in the crowd, and they were also very busy. Maybe it’s because “I can’t understand it, but I’m very shocked.” An elderly man sighed, “We also get to know the things of young people. It’s lively, fun, and fresh.”

; < p>; "Don't you think this is a release? A release of stress." Another Shanghai uncle talked to a Southern Weekend reporter. He had been standing on the roadside for two hours, observing and feeling the carnival atmosphere. My uncle is from Shanghai, but he has never seen such an atmosphere. "I am very happy to see such an atmosphere. I think everyone is also happy from the bottom of their hearts. This is not a festival. Everyone is just using the festival as an excuse to be happy." , pure joy.”

;

;“Go crazy together and release stress”

;

;A novel scene appeared at the subway entrance near Julu Road. Many people gathered together to exchange professional opinions. So much so that the subway entrance was blocked again. Some said they were studying law, some were studying civil engineering, and some were studying architecture. Everyone complained that it was difficult to get along in the corresponding industry.

;

;What resonated strongly was the boy Xiao Xie who was surrounded. He looked haggard and had pale lips. The card hanging on his chest had four big words written on it: Studying Architecture. He was also carrying a bag with two wads of toilet paper. take-out box, looking impoverished. "It is true that this industry is not very prosperous, and my work is not going well, so I take this opportunity to go crazy together."

;

;"Everyone is going crazy, and I want to go crazy too. It feels so good, and I put all my inner thoughts into it." Release the pressure." Xiao Xie just did a bold thing and resigned naked in October 2023. It was a period of work where "I couldn't move even if I wanted to curl up, but I didn't dare to lie down". Everyone didn't dare to leave their seats after get off work, and they were chased by their leaders to make work demands.

;

;The migrant worker who is even more out of the circle is Li Qiubai, the actor of Party B who wanders the same street. His makeup was rough and exaggerated, and the dark eye shadow and highlighter applied to his face made it look like his cheekbones were protruding and his cheeks were sunken. He had an A4 paper with "Party B" written on it in the collar of his checkered shirt, clearly showing a person who had been squeezed by Party A for a long time. haggard beat worker.

;

;;

;

;Party B cosplayer. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;“I cosplayed a character who had just finished his shift, and I didn’t expect the effect to be so good.” Li Qiubai had indeed just finished his shift, and it was already late at night when he arrived at Julu Road, so he decided to perform a Party B, who was tired, was constantly surrounded by people taking photos. The number of views on his social account has "exploded", and many netizens have left messages expressing sympathy. "Some people read the jokes, and some people look in the mirror. There are many comments like this."

;

;"Maybe it's because after the epidemic, there is no such activity that everyone can enjoy. Although the previous festivals were holidays, various tickets were not available." Li Qiubai said that now it has reached a In a festival where everyone can go crazy, I have an outlet to vent.

;

;Here, Li Qiubai also encountered many poor people who did not need to dress up, as well as the resentful Party A. Some people held up signs: "People who usually have a hard time pretending to be themselves don't need to dress up for Halloween." It's OK." Li Qiubai summed up this type of cosplay as: using realistic expression techniques to present the things that workers fear most.

;

;On the evening of October 31st, many cosplayers said they came over right after get off work. A King Zhou finished putting on a solemn dramatic face in his company, and walked around the streets to find two strangers, Daji, to form a CP; a 28-year-old young man drove here from Jiaxing City, Zhejiang Province, and she cosplayed Hayao Miyazaki's classic animated character, the Faceless Man, stood hunched silently on the roadside, with more than a hundred people gathered around to take a group photo. Because she had to go to work the next day, she returned to Jiaxing overnight.

;

;Wang Gongzi chose to release herself in another way. She played the role of SpongeBob SquarePants, who is also 37 years old. On weekdays, she is engaged in the company's business work, talking about cost-effectiveness and the company's maximum benefits. But before Halloween comes, the homemade yellow felt board square shell makes her purely the embodiment of happiness.

;

;When Mr. Wang cosplayed Spongebob Squarepants into Happy Valley, he immediately became the center of attention and was even mistaken by tourists for being a professional staff member of the park. A crowd of chirping children followed her, stuffing her with candies and throwing out a hundred thousand whys: Did Mr. Krabs give you a day off? Why don't you bring Xiaowei to play with you? What’s the secret ingredient to the Krusty Krab?

;

;That night, Mr. Wang said, the whole group went crazy. Di Dixi, a colleague cosplaying as a Haidilao waiter, was originally a typical i person (referring to an introvert). In this atmosphere, she was directly reshaped into an e person (referring to an extrovert). She would take the initiative to get in front of some tourists. There is no real thing to do in the crazy performance, just twisting the hands in the air, but it is self-intoxicating.

;

;That night, Di Dixi also interviewed "Li Jiaqi", a cosplayer who sells eyebrow pencils for 79 yuan. The other person responded in a long voice, "Why is it so expensive? It's always the same price. It's really annoying." Dixi burst into laughter on the spot. Later, this video unexpectedly went viral. Prince Wang and his friends were all shocked. Is the Sheniu girl in front of them the same Didixi who dared not speak in front of others and pretended to be immersed in looking at her mobile phone?

;

;"She became more aggressive after she woke up the next day. Looking back, she felt so embarrassed and a little bit ashamed." Didisi's friend recalled to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Within a few days, Didixi led her two friends who were smarter than herself and headed towards Julu Road. She put on heavy makeup and went back.

;

;;

;

;There are people on the street who are cosplaying and learning computers. (Visual China/Picture)

;

;“Take advantage of the popularity to become a fan”

;

;Chen Yanzhi is on the hot search again. In 2022, he was dressed like An Lingrong and danced on roller skates, which made him a hot search. After all, "The Legend of Zhen Huan" is the "electronic mustard" for all.

;

;In this sea of ​​folk joy, Halloween has also become a traffic carnival, with many video teams wandering around.

;

;“She is so hot.” ​​A Ying, who cosplayed An Lingrong’s Maid, was a little proud. She told Southern Weekend reporters that after deciding to perform the scene of “An Lingrong singing on the bow”, several commercials A team of people made careful planning and posted a "thaw" trailer on the short video platform, implying An Lingrong's return. They also made a video invitation with a route plan.

;

;“What we are looking for is Lalamove to drag the prop boat over. As soon as it got off the cargo puller, many people called An Lingrong.” On the evening of October 28, An Lingrong was sitting on the boat. As soon as he came out, he was surrounded by a crowd of people, which directly diverted the traffic of other nearby cosplayers. They put on cheap wigs and the same costumes as in the play. An Lingrong on the bow of the boat was holding a lotus. The music "Lotus Can Be Picked in Jiangnan" was played on the Bluetooth speaker, and everyone sang along.

;

;The number of likes for the short video shot by the team at that time soared to tens of thousands. When it came to Fuxing Park for the second time, thousands of people watched the live broadcast. "It's quite fun. Everyone came up with a lot of creative ideas. I finally saw how relaxed the people in Shanghai are." A Ying said.

;

;An Lingrong’s previous appearance in the industry also inspired the Hangzhou boy Xingxing. In this Halloween, he became popular with his cosplay of Xiang Tai. In one of his most widely circulated videos, Xingxing is wearing a pink coat that the team temporarily bought for 400 yuan, looking rich and wealthy. Someone asked him what he thought of Xiangtai's daughter-in-law Guo Biting. He smiled slightly and imitated: "It's easy to control."

;

;In response, Xiangtai himself responded from a distance: "The clothes are too low, he should imitate Make it more beautiful." This shocked the Xingxing team. Originally, everyone joked that the Halloween cosplay star lineup would be enough to receive letters from lawyers from all the celebrities on the Internet, but it was so popular that people were still caught off guard. "We were actually a little scared, afraid that if the Xiangzuo team came to us and asked us if we had any problems, but in the end they only said to interact, then we went to interact." Ami, a staff member of the Xingxing team, told a Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;Ami introduced that Xingxing is a self-media beauty blogger. After causing trouble with Taizhuang, many cooperative merchants approached us, "Many people sent us private messages to discuss cooperation. We should wake up We woke up and pretended to interact with each other, but we refused because we were afraid of being scolded."

;

;Some people were worried and some were happy. After seeing Xiang Tai and An Lingrong become popular on the Internet, Na Ying, the actor who plays Na Ying, was also moved. "Then I have to go." On November 1, she imitated Na Ying's tone on the other end of the phone when being interviewed by a Southern Weekend reporter. Previously, she bought the clothes of Li Minglang in "The Wife's Secret", the lowest version of sunglasses, hairpins and a microphone, and went to Julu Road for three nights in a row, imitating Na Ying and constantly uttering "that language", "I'm a Open your mouth and they will howl and scream.”

;

;The results are immediate. This British version of Na Ying brings traffic wherever he goes. Even if he puts on a mask, takes off his glasses, or puts on friends' clothes, he will still be recognized. He has experienced the treatment of a star being chased. "They thought I was the real Na Ying. Everyone screamed, saying it looked too much like me. They shouted, 'That sister, don't run away,' and 'That sister, take a picture of me.'"

;

;"Before I went, I I knew I would be out of the circle, but I was just not sure to what extent." In three days, Naying's Douyin followers increased by nearly 100,000, and she held on to her traffic password tightly, "After I got home on Halloween night, I still I started a live broadcast, hoping to take advantage of the popularity to gain some followers."

;

;During the carnival on October 31, a roar suddenly made the noisy crowd pause. "Aren't you going to let people pass?" A delivery boy who was stuck in the crowd got angry, and his wheels were unable to move at this moment.

;

;But the atmosphere soon recovered. Scenes like this were no stranger. From time to time, a delivery boy shouted in the excited crowd: "Give way, it's timeout, it's timeout." In this moment of discussion. In a carnival where it is not clear whether it is true or false, it is difficult not to suspect that they are cosplaying with the delivery boy. During the interview, some people also cast doubtful looks at Southern Weekend reporters and asked, "Are you a cosplay reporter?"

;

;Until midnight, the flow of people on Julu Road gradually died down. After this night, Shanghai will return to the tense and rhythmic side of the metropolis.

;The sea is blue and you can't see the edge at a glance. To the outside is a beach filled with vacationers. Further outward is the main road, which is flat and wide. A wheelchair is coming from a distance and is moving from the asphalt road to the seaside.

;

;This is Sanya, Hainan. The soft and fine sand shows high quality, but it is a challenge for wheelchairs. The wheels of the wheelchair sank easily, and Ye Ye sat on it. Someone had to pull him backwards and forward so that he could move slowly. Little by little, and then little by little, the beach and the sea came to the young man at a slower speed.

;

;The most difficult situation when going out is that you often have to wait, "waiting for someone to help you show up." Tian Tian recalled the journey with me several times. For example, from the main road to the beach, a half-meter-high iron railing blocked his eyes. Others could step over it in one go, but he could not.

;

;Skating, playing, and driving, before the age of 17, the young man from Xi'an was very active in the fields and saw a future that was "omnipotent." In 2004, an accidental car accident caused him to become a high-level paraplegic and he could only sit in a wheelchair since then.

;

;While waiting passively, he and other "injured friends" in wheelchairs encouraged each other and went out to draw a map of barrier-free facilities within the third ring road of Xi'an's main city. Mark the existing problems and open the way out. It took 3 months, 4 wheelchairs, and 15 hours a day to create a barrier-free map of 597 square kilometers. Thousands of marks were made in three color categories, covering all the main roads in the Third Ring Road of Xi'an. The relevant departments cleaned up accordingly. Obstacles, more ways out appear in the eyes of people with disabilities.

;

;Along the way, they have encountered a lot of criticism, "Why can't we just take a detour? Why do we have to take this road?"

;

;"I didn't want to take a shortcut, I just wanted to Take the original path." Tian Ye sat in a wheelchair and repeated this answer.

;

;;

;

;"Injured Friends" push wheelchairs together on the barrier-free passage Picture/Microfilm "Hey, Come Out" ;;

;

;Precise physical needs

;

;One wheelchair met another wheelchair, more and more, five or six people driving wheelchairs gathered in the open field, "Hey , come out!" After a simple greeting, they started the competition - wheelchair racing.

;

;The track is very long and needs to go through some barrier-free passages. Slight irregularities on the road may cause the wheelchair to slow down or even pause. This is the road they have driven on countless times in wheelchairs. Irregularities were marked, fed back, and resolved one by one.

;

;After the race is over, they will meet for a meal at a Chuanchuan restaurant in Tianye. There, people with disabilities receive a 50% discount on dining, and it is a regular gathering place for "injured friends".

;

;But for several days, I never waited for such a scene. In mid-September, it was the rainy season in Xi'an. The rain lasted for more than ten days, separating the previous summer from the following winter. "There is no autumn in Xi'an," the locals say. The weather turned from hot to cold in the blink of an eye, leaving no time for preparation.

;

;Even after living in Xi'an for decades, the "injured friends" still feel uncomfortable even with slight changes in the weather. When the rain comes, they can't get out even more.

;

;It’s not easy to get together. They are slowly getting used to it, just like many details in life, they need to adapt again and find a new order in time.

;

;They need precise control over their physical needs. For example, drinking water, the simplest thing, needs to be done regularly, quantitatively, and managed accurately. Otherwise, it will be impossible to control the timing of defecation and defecation, which will make it more difficult to go out. It is impossible not to drink water. Some people have tried it to treat bladder system infections and urinary tract infections. Problems will ensue.

;

;;

;

;After the filming of the micro-film was completed, Tian Ye and the crew took a group photo;(Photo provided by the Online Merchant Bank Charity Store Alliance);

;

;The speed of drinking water must also be controlled. If you drink too fast or too hard, the water will flow from the throat to the bladder too quickly, and errors will occur. A five-minute time difference will be enough for a wheelchair when going out. It could mean an accident lasting more than two hours. The two-hour trip was compact: find a suitable spot, clean yourself up, then open the door and walk onto the street, pretending that nothing had happened.

;

;Developing a tacit understanding with the body requires coping with seasonal changes. For example, in summer and winter, people sweat differently, and the corresponding drinking patterns are naturally different. The exploration of every tiny pattern comes from the fact that "injured friends" cannot resist the temptation to go out deep in their hearts.

;

;The 50% discount skewers shop opened by Tian Ye is also one of the temptations for "injured friends" to go out. When he was 17 years old, he suffered an accidental car accident and became paraplegic. He relied on a wheelchair to travel and became a member of the "Injured Friends" circle.

;

;The first time I saw Tianye was at his home. Urinary tract infection is one of the common diseases among injured people. Tian Tian has just returned from the hospital for infusion. He is sitting in a wheelchair, his body tilted to one side, and the tail end of his speech hangs on the ground, with the exhaustion of struggling to maintain his strength. He has sneakers on his feet, and he needs help from time to time to move him, making sure he is on the pedals of his wheelchair. When chatting for a long time, he needs to move. The effect of gravity will make his feet more and more uncomfortable until he asks the people around him for help.

;

;Most of the time, this person is his father. "Dad, drink water." "Dad, Coke." There is no need to thank you, explain, or any other reason. A long time will reduce such a conversation to the most direct expression.

;

;Ye Ye lives in Qujiang New District, Xi'an City, where there is an average of one public restroom every few hundred meters, equipped with barrier-free restrooms. Tian Ye sat in an electric wheelchair and drove skillfully to a public restroom near his home.

;

;Open the door of the barrier-free bathroom. The facilities inside are complete. There are facilities where babies can be placed on horizontal boards while they lie down to change diapers, and there are facilities where babies can be fixedly seated on one side for parents to use the toilet. There are also facilities with handrails for people with disabilities to use the toilet.

;

;On the other hand, only those who actually use it can feel the subtle differences. Tian Ye pushed his wheelchair and walked to the mirror. He couldn't see himself in the neat and clean half-length mirror. Tian Tian explained that the mirror needs to have a certain tilt so that you can see your face from a low position. I tried to bend down and lower my head so that my line of sight was at the same height as his head in the wheelchair. I no longer dare to call it a "slight" difference.

;

;The two sides of the barrier-free passage leading from the main road to the bathroom are not smooth, but standing aside, you can't tell the abnormality. "Both sides are uneven," Tian Ye's father measured it with his hands. The relevant road regulations stipulate that the error cannot exceed 2 centimeters. "Within 1 centimeter (error) does not affect the wheelchair going up and down, but there is at least a 5 centimeter error on this road." Until Tian Ye's wheelchair slowly moved up, it pushed hard several times. If I don't get up, a sudden acceleration may cause it to roll over. Only then do I realize what the slightest difference in sight means to a wheelchair.

;

;Tian Ye then explained the classification of the blind walk he just walked through: there are two types of blind walk bricks. The strip-shaped ones are guide bricks, which guide the blind people to move forward safely and securely. These are called marching blind walk bricks; the other kind They are dot-shaped reminder bricks that are used to remind blind people that there are obstacles ahead and they should make a turn. These are called blind trail bricks.

;

;"I didn't understand anything before," Tian Ye smiled and began to recall the point where he "understood", which was an accidental car accident.

;

;;

;

;Tianye’s Chuanchuan shop has become a gathering place for "injured friends";(provided by the Online Merchant Bank Charity Store Alliance/Picture );

;

;A show for everyone

;

;The gray-white Santana passed by, and the license plate number stayed in Tianye’s heart, and he could still blurt it out many years later.

;

;Before the car passed by, life in the field was "moving". He was born in 1987, and his ancestors have lived near the Big Wild Goose Pagoda in Xi'an for generations. Tian Ye has been naughty and active since he was a child, and likes to watch martial arts movies. The famous scene of "The Lion King's Fight for Hegemony" in "Once Upon a Time" starring Jet Li left a deep impression on him.

;

;Later, he went to a martial arts school and practiced martial arts for two full years from the age of 13 to 15. When he was young, he loved roller skating. He was always the best and fastest skater. At that time, there was a popular game called "train driving". A group of people were dragged forward and backward, sometimes straight, sometimes diagonally, changing formations. The person driving first was called the "locomotive" and asked whether the train was fast or not. "It all depends on the head." Tian Tian always plays the role of the locomotive. With a background in martial arts school, his speed, balance and strength are outstanding, "like autumn leaves falling in the air", he can do side flips and splits easily, and he can pull more than a hundred people while pulling a train.

;

;Later, I stopped studying and learning martial arts. I drove a bulldozer and repaired cars in the field. At the construction site, except for tower cranes, he has driven all other "cars" that can be seen.

;

;This speed stopped when I was 17 years old. In 2004, Tianye was involved in a car accident. After saving his life, he stayed in the ICU (Intensive Care Unit) for 21 days, which cost him no idea how much money he spent. Then he lay in bed for another eight months, becoming skin and bones. It was the most painful period in his life. Tian Ye recalled that at that time, he was over 1.7 meters tall and weighed only 70 to 80 kilograms. His ribs were clearly visible, and he could be seen clearly.

;

;In the next 10 years, his parents took him to seek medical advice everywhere, including specialist hospitals and charlatans. I don’t know how many folk remedies and secret recipes have been tried, money was spent, and hardships were endured, but the person failed to stand up. "Kaizi (;local dialect, meaning 'fool';) was deceived, and Dangdang was different," Tian Ye lamented the state of the family at that time , unwilling to accept the facts, always feel that I can still stand up, and I should be able to stand up.

;

;Unable to find an exit in reality, Tianye kept a dream in his heart. In the dream, he entered a temple. Many monks were meditating and knocking wooden fish. He knelt in front of the Buddha statue. Suddenly the door of the Main Hall opened, and with a golden light, an old monk came in. He said to Tian Tian, ​​"You should have gone to hell."

;

;Tian Tian was puzzled and asked crying, "I am so kind, why not What terrible bad things have you done? Why do I have to go to hell? Why do I have to sit in a wheelchair?"

;

;The monk replied, "Sitting in a wheelchair is already very good. You were going to hell." The monk was in the air Drawing a circle, it looked like a TV. In it, Tianye saw that he was a prince. He ran into a temple during the fighting and knocked off the head of a Bodhisattva statue with a wooden stick. After reading it, Tian Ye cried loudly in his dream and continued to cry when he woke up.

;

;After crying, although the dream was illusory, Tian Ye seemed to have found some reason for comfort outside of reality. He was no longer confused, no longer felt targeted by fate.

;

;When talking about the node of change, Tian Ye pondered for a while and talked about "mission."

;

;"What is your mission?"

;

;"I am performing a play, and the audience is everyone. I used to be a very naughty child, and I had an accident. Some people say that it is retribution, or karma, because I was too naughty before, and others would use me to educate their children. At first I felt disgusted, but later I was happy, and my experience became the opposite of what parents should do to educate their children. Textbook - 'Don't learn from Tianye'. From here, I slowly found the direction of my life and was no longer lonely."

;

;Tianye decided to open a skewers shop. It was first opened in a community. In May 2013, from eight briquette stoves, an umbrella, and a few benches, to sixty or seventy stoves, sheds, and prefabricated houses, it "became stylish." .

;

;;

;

;In the summer of 2021, Tianye and "injured friends" experienced barrier-free facilities at Qujiangnan Lake in Xi'an;(provided by interviewees/ Picture);

;

;In June 2021, the store moved to a shop about 1 km away from home. "That was the best time for business." The 120-square-meter store can accommodate hundreds of tables every day, and there are so many people that it can't accommodate them. Half a year later, the store expanded again, and Tian Tian changed the lease to a 300-square-meter store next door. In the middle of the month after the move, cases of new coronavirus pneumonia appeared in Xi'an. In November 2021, Tianye's Chuanchuan store closed just after it opened. For the entire year of 2022, the store was closed for 180 days and suffered a loss of hundreds of thousands.

;

;By 2023, Tian Ye thought that the epidemic was gone, policies were relaxed, and everything would get better, but business has slowed down. In mid-September when we met, the store was being renovated, and Tianye wanted to use a new look to welcome back its former prosperity.

;

;"Should the new store install a barrier-free bathroom?" I looked at him and asked at another rice noodle shop in Tianye. This rice noodle shop may not be able to open anymore. Tian Tian wants to alleviate some of the financial pressure so that he can start it again in the future. The rice noodle shop's rent expense is about 90,000 yuan a year, and its business is not doing well. He analyzed that it is because the location is not good. While we were chatting in front of the store, light rain fell from time to time. This store is sandwiched behind an office building. There are several fast food restaurants nearby. The business is not very good. There are few pedestrians on the street on rainy days.

;

;He said that he had considered installing a barrier-free bathroom, but it was still unrealistic. Fortunately and conveniently, there is a public restroom about 100 meters away from the Chuanchuan store. There are barrier-free facilities there to facilitate "injured friends" to solve toilet problems.

;

;Since the store opened, people with disabilities will receive a 15% discount when they come to the Chuanchuan store in Tianye. In May 2021, the MYbank Charity Store Alliance was established, and Tianye’s Chuanchuan store joined. With the support of MYbank, it launched a set meal activity for people with disabilities to eat skewers at half price. Wang Ye is the initiator of this charity store project. She introduced that the main users of the platform are small shop owners. While doing this charity project, she wanted to know who the “shopkeepers” were. During the epidemic at that time, Wang Ye first came into contact with the owner of a dumpling restaurant in Xi'an. Some people came to Xi'an to look for jobs but could not find jobs and had spent all their money. The boss posted a piece of paper at the door to the effect of "It's no big deal if you have difficulties. Come in." Eat a bowl of dumplings for free." The charity shop project gave the dumpling shop owner a subsidy of 10,000 yuan. "How can there be such a sincere person? He is obviously very difficult."

;

;Later, Wang Ye discovered Tianye's Chuan Chuan shop and also gave him 10,000 yuan in support. "Injured friends can eat Chuan Chuan at 50% off." ” activity is online. Wang Ye's task is to find 1,000 such stores across the country. "1,000 is our upper limit. We don't look for people who are determined to do charity from the beginning, because it will be difficult to persist. We look for people who are already in the normal business." run." After contacting many such small charity shops, Wang Ye lamented that charity does not rely on emotional impulse. It requires a sense of purpose and values ​​​​in the heart. It cannot be a temporary passion, but must always be a belief, "I Know what I'm doing."

;

;;

;

;During the filming of the micro-film, director Wang Ye (first from left) and the injured experienced wheelchair travel; (Photo provided by MYBank Charity Store Alliance);

;

;Leave it to time to present

;

;In addition to Chuan Chuan store, Ye Ye and the wounded friends’ charity territory “It’s also about creating an accessibility map.

;

;In August 2018, Tian Ye and six people with disabilities he met jointly raised funds to establish the "SCI Wingless Flying" charity center. "You want to fly even if you don't have wings" is their original intention of establishing "Wingless Flight".

;

;After the establishment of "Wingless Flying", Ye Ye and the wounded friends spent three months conducting a road barrier-free environment survey within the third ring road in Xi'an. The idea was originally proposed by "wounded friend" Huang Yuan of.

;

;Huang Yuan, 52 years old, was involved in a car accident in July 2011. The 9th to 12th ribs of his chest were injured. Since then, he has needed to use a wheelchair to travel. In a wheelchair, he ran a half-marathon.

;

;When it comes to going out with "injured friends", he feels less pressure. The most difficult thing may be the problem of temporary toileting. For example, if you cannot control your bowels and bowels well, especially stool, you have to return home or clean yourself little by little in the accessible toilet, which can take an hour or two. "Injured friends" can completely understand each other with a look or a word. They can give full understanding without explanation, because they have "equal bodies."

;

;The most serious problem with his body is that he has no feeling. His thigh swelled three times its original size after going out once, and the injury was not discovered until then. The scar on the right leg was left in May 2022 and is still not healed. He rolled up his trouser legs, and there were deep and shallow scars on his uneven calves.

;

;When it comes to going out, Huang Yuan is always full of smiles. "Injured friends" drove wheelchairs on the road to observe, and if they found any problems with barrier-free facilities, they took photos and sent them to Huang Yuan, collecting tens of thousands of photos. Huang Yuan finally selected the 5,000 available photos and made them into an electronic map. This requires a lot of behind-the-scenes work, such as reversely reading the coordinates from the GPS, then mapping the photos to the corresponding locations and marking them with markers of different colors.

;

;This electronic map is distinguished by different layers: one is divided according to administrative regions, and the other is classified according to reasons, including irregular design, inadequate construction, and later damage and loss.

;

;Based on Huang Yuan’s experience, most of the design plans are in place because there are standard drawings. However, during the construction and supervision and acceptance processes, problems sometimes occur and "look-alikes" appear.

;

;After three months of research, Huang Yuan compiled the "Investigation Report on the Status of Accessible Facilities in Xi'an" and produced a special electronic map of the distribution of accessibility problems in Xi'an, clearly marking every existence Location, image representation, cause category, etc. of accessibility issues.

;

;The results of the investigation were sent to the relevant road administration departments by email, and some of the problems were corrected. The map and report are still kept in Huang Yuan's computer, even though the "Public Welfare Center" is currently unable to maintain due to insufficient funds.

;

;The complete investigation was not there at the beginning. It was initially a sporadic "love post". Liu Sifang took out a pile from under the coffee table. The pink post-it note had the words "I am a disabled person and your vehicle blocks the barrier-free passage" printed on it. He also had a pile in his wheelchair backpack and took it with him when he went out.

;

;Liu Sifang is 60 years old this year. When he was 50 years old, he suffered from a vascular attack and leaked his carotid artery. The doctor told him that there were no more than 50 cases of people suffering from this rare disease worldwide. In 2014, he underwent surgery at Xi'an Medical College, and his life since then has been inseparable from crutches and wheelchairs.

;

;Liu Sifang keeps several parrots at home. They fly around the room, sometimes landing on their shoulders and sometimes on their heads, adding a bit of life. He gave these birds names, which was a lot of fun at home.

;

;When talking about making love stickers and barrier-free access maps, Liu Sifang mentioned, "It is to find a reason to go out."

;

;It was originally a sporadic love sticker, but later it hurt Friends thought, "Forget it, just run by yourself and be a whole person."

;

;"The people who check and accept are not disabled." When talking about the problems encountered in using barrier-free facilities, Liu Sifang has more options Understand: You will encounter non-compliant "slope problems", and some make barrier-free passages into gravel roads, maybe for the sake of appearance, but small-wheel wheelchairs cannot go there, so you have to use large-wheel wheelchairs, which limits some wheelchairs. Travel... Such details can only be truly understood by sitting in a wheelchair.

;

;Acceleration is addictive. In order to let more "wounded friends" go out and to encourage themselves, for 3 months, 4 wheelchairs, and 15 hours a day, the "wounded friends" of the small shop walked out of Xi'an. A barrier-free map of 597 square kilometers, with 3 colors and thousands of markers, covering all the main roads in Xi'an's third ring road. The "injured friends" are called the "little princes of wheelchair racing". They often meet in the suburbs of Xi'an to compete in wheelchairs.

;

;Going out is a dilemma and a temptation. The farthest place Tian Ye has ever been was Sanya, which was five or six years ago. Facing the sea, with the sun on his head and the beach at his feet, drinking ice-cold watermelon juice and wearing sunglasses, he seemed to be in a new world. It was the Spring Festival, and it was the middle of winter in my hometown of Xi'an, thousands of miles away. The wind was blowing and the snow was shining.

;

;He is not good at expressing himself. How can he describe the sound of the waves? Speaking of that kind of remoteness, Tianye's gaze lengthened and became farther and farther, passing through the wall in front of him. A faint smile appeared on his face, and he seemed to hear it again, that "like the spring in Xi'an".

;

;"Waiting for someone to help you appear" is the good luck you may need when going out. Just a few days before our interview, it rained heavily in Xi'an. There was something going on in the store that had to be checked. Tian Ye drove his electric wheelchair out and accidentally fell into a puddle on the side of the road. He didn't notice it because the rain was so heavy that the puddle was covered. The mother saw that he hadn't left for a long time, so she came back to look for him along the road, only to find her son kneeling on the ground, half of his body soaked in water.

;

;There were not many pedestrians on the rainy day. A woman wanted to help, but she was not strong enough. Later, a man came and several people worked together to rescue Tianye. The wait took half an hour. "There were also people who passed by but didn't help," Tian Ye added lightly at the end.

;

;When you go out, you will hear voices of opposition, "Disabled people can't do anything, just stay at home. Why go out? It will only cause chaos to society."

;

;Tianye is not satisfied with this. He felt angry when he said, "A normal society should be an inclusive society. It should not only tolerate people, but also small animals, flowers and plants on the road."

;

;During the contact, Wang Ye felt the affection of Tian Ye Optimism has a sad undertone. "He is not heartless or painless. He will have many moments of contemplation. The difficulties he encounters are all business-related. Physically, he is used to it." In Wang Ye's eyes, Tian Ye is a store owner who operates with heart. "I would rather introduce him as a hard-working person and a store owner, rather than introducing him as a person with a disability first."

;

;10 years Before, I had the idea of ​​writing a book. Sitting in a wheelchair, Tian Ye talked about the past intermittently. He wanted to write about his life. The window was behind him, and the rain was pattering outside, making the room a little cool.

;

;“I have not thought about the beginning and the end,” Tian Ye answered my question about the book “A Lifetime”. “Maybe life is meaningless, but it does not mean that it should be spent casually. I know my own No matter what the script looks like, I will still act it out." In this book, he wanted to tell it step by step and use time to present it.

; Sat, 04 Nov 2023 09:25:03 +0800 黄仕忠：怀念郭在贻老师http://www.infzm.com/contents/259816
;;2023-11-04 08:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Guo Zaiyi (1939-1989). ;(Photo courtesy of Guo Xianyu);

;

;Teacher Guo Zaiyi is fundamentally a very proud person. More than thirty years after his death, I read a long letter he wrote to his brother Guo Lianyi on November 21, 1977. He talked freely about calligraphy schools and famous calligraphers at that time, and criticized Fang Qiu. in this way. The depth of calligraphy attainments seen in the handwriting astonished me. Because he knew what he said, it flowed out naturally from his mind. To him, it was just a normal conversation with his brother. Since it was a private letter, there was no need to be restrained, so he spoke frankly and heartily, rather than pretending to make shocking remarks.

;

;;

;

;Guo Zaiyi wrote to his brother Guo Lianyi. ;(Information picture/picture);

;

;In 1988, Teacher Guo worked with students to complete the first draft of "Review of the Dunhuang Bian Anthology". A friend wrote in a letter: "This manuscript is devoted to our own opinions. We are confident and not without inventions. There are many unique secrets in the research and interpretation of common words and proverbs." It is also full of confidence rather than boasting. This tone can be seen or heard in his letters and conversations with friends.

;

;Teacher Guo and I only exchanged words occasionally. He is not tall and his eyes are not big, but they are bright and bright. When he glances past with slightly squinted eyes, he seems to be condescending, which makes me feel uncomfortable. Health shrinks.

;

;At that time, he had just passed his forties, and his body seemed to be condensed with infinite energy, shining so brightly that it was impossible to look directly at it. Especially in the field of Chinese history, he is the person who carries the banner after Jiang Liangfu and Jiang Lihong. In July 1986, with the approval of the Discipline Review Group of the State Council, the Chinese Department of Hangzhou University welcomed a new group of doctoral supervisors after Mr. Jiang Liangfu. They are: Shen Wenzhuo, Jiang Lihong, Xu Shuofang, and Guo Zaiyi. The first three are all over 60 years old, and Mr. Guo is only 47 years old. He was the youngest doctoral supervisor in the field of humanities and social sciences at that time.

;

;When I was an undergraduate (1978-1982), he offered elective courses for the 1978 and 1979 students. I didn’t choose them at the time, but I have looked up to him for a long time.

;

;At that time, several students in Grade 77, influenced by Teacher Guo’s ancient Chinese class, spontaneously formed an interest group to carry out research on word exegesis. One of them is named Bian Xincan, who is from my hometown, and we are the same age, so we have a lot of exchanges. He said: "Teacher Guo is knowledgeable and humorous in class. One of the sentences touched me very much: 'Discovering a new meaning is like discovering a planet.' It can be said to illuminate my soul." So he dived into ancient books. In the pile, I made cards and copied words. By the fourth grade (1981), I published papers in "Hangzhou University Journal" and "Chinese Language". He was only 21 years old that year. His graduation thesis was also supervised by Teacher Guo. I have read his paper published in "Hangzhou University Newspaper". The words he explained are well-documented and convincing. They are exactly the same as Mr. Jiang Lihong's "Explanation of the Meanings of Dunhuang Bianwenwen". He said that after the article was written, he cautiously submitted it to Mr. Jiang Lihong, and received enthusiastic guidance and recommendation to "Hangzhou University Newspaper"; the article in "Chinese Language" was accepted by his own submission. At that time, many teachers were struggling to write papers and therefore could not be promoted, so this incident left a deep impression on me.

;

;Wang Yimin, Zhang Yongquan, and Ji Weiqiang in the interest group also published papers in influential professional journals when they were in college or early after graduation. Yimin said that he was slightly excited when he saw his name listed with Mr. Ni Baoyuan, a teacher from Hangzhou University, in the catalog of "Chinese Language". Yongquan re-entered Hangzhou University two years after graduation and studied for graduate school with Professor Guo, opening up a new world in the field of Dunhuang colloquial word research. Behind this, you can see the figure of Teacher Guo Zaiyi. They were just undergraduates, but under Teacher Guo's guidance, they achieved such outstanding results. As a student at the time, I admired him very much and could not imagine how great he was.

;

;It was in the autumn of 1982 that I was admitted to the graduate school of ancient literature at our university after graduating from my undergraduate degree. Teachers Guo Zaiyi, Zhu Hongxi and others recruited six graduate students in ancient Chinese, including Fang Yixin, Chen Baiye, Jin Xiaochun, Guo Xiaowu, Wang Yunlu and Ye Qing. The boys' dormitory is next to each other. Yixin, Baiye and I are undergraduate classmates, so I often visit them and listen to their discussions. Teacher Guo asked me to read through the paragraph notes of "Shuowen" first with punctuation. At that time, there was a photocopy of the notes, with a purple cover and a large format. Each of them had it open on the table. It was very solemn and quite showing off, because "our Teacher Guo" believed that this was the right way to get started, and Teacher Guo himself ordered it. Read it three or four times. This made me very envious, and I bought a copy. However, I hesitated repeatedly on whether to read it through, and finally gave up, because at that time I was working on "Historical Records" and "Han Dynasty" under the guidance of Master Xu Shuo. There is not enough time for comparison of books. In the second academic year, I returned to opera from "History" and "Han" and systematically read through the basic literature on Yuan and Ming opera. In fact, I was indirectly influenced by Teacher Guo.

;

;Teacher Guo gave his graduate students a course on "Exegesis of Chu Ci", and I also took the course. This was the first time I walked into his class. It was an eye-opener and I was hooked.

;

;;

;

;When Teacher Guo was young, he was full of sunshine. ;(Photo courtesy of Guo Xianyu);

;

;Teacher Guo is from Zouping, Shandong, and has a strong accent. For me, a Zhejiang native, it sounds a bit strange. The pronunciation of the characters is quite difficult to distinguish. Even so, his lectures were engaging. He first put forward examples and listed different theories, and then laid out his evidence, one, two, three, four, as if he were doing vertical arithmetic problems for primary school students, with clear layers and a clear view. In fact, it is extremely difficult to select examples for exegesis. Unless you are very familiar with the semantics of words and their origins, you will not be able to find accurate examples.

;

;Unfortunately, I only thought that it was enough to understand some "methods" of exegesis. I only had a superficial taste of Mr. Guo's thesis, and my understanding was not deep enough. Teacher Guo is based on his own years of research and combines the results of his predecessors to provide supplementary extensions and demonstrations in class. The core content has been published. One article is "Exegesis of Chu Ci", published in "Literary History" (6th and 14th series, 1979, 1982); the other is "Explanation of Vernacular Poems of the Tang Dynasty", published in " Chinese Language, Issue 6, 1983. In 1984, with these two papers, he won the second prize of the first Young Linguist Award of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences (a total of three people won the award, the other two being Li Jiahao and Jiang Shaoyu from the Chinese Department of Peking University). This award was established after the "Cultural Revolution" by Mr. Lu Shuxiang with a donation to commend young scholars (limited to those under 45 years old). There was no first prize in the "first edition", so this is the highest award. Two years later, he was approved as a doctoral supervisor. It is said that Mr. Xu Fu greatly appreciated his research and strongly recommended him.

;

;I have mostly forgotten many of Mr. Guo’s incisive explanations, but some of the “methods” he taught played a real role in my subsequent academic research.

;

;For example, Teacher Guo introduced the concept of continuous words, which are mostly double-sounding rhymes that must emphasize their sounds. There are different writing methods with similar sounds, and they cannot be broken into single characters for explanation. He also said that some of them were discovered by Mr. Jiang Liangfu. Mr. Jiang's famous work "Collation and Annotation of Qu Yuan's Fu" was completed when he was only 29 years old (originally written in 1929 and completed in 1931). I looked through the "Chu Ci" and found that dozens of words are continuous words. However, most of the annotated versions of contemporary scholars still use split words for explanation. In other words, just relying on "continuous words" as a trace gave the young Jiang Liangfu many new insights. His graduation thesis at Tsinghua University, "An Examination of Shi Sao Lian Mian Zi", was supervised by Wang Guowei. Wang Guowei keenly listed the discussion of Qing Confucianism as a special topic. He only pointed out the problem in one article and gave the topic to the students. The students followed this and expanded it to open up their own fields. This allowed me to see the necessity of mastering "academic principles" and "criteria", and at the same time I also learned the importance of "family law" and "teacher-to-teacher inheritance".

;

;Teacher Guo gave a wonderful explanation in class on the difficult words in Chu Ci, as well as the words that scholars in the past considered "unexplainable". From Wang Yi, Zhu Xi, Hong Xingzu, to Guo Moruo and other contemporary famous Chu Ci scholars, they all revealed certain weaknesses in the face of his exquisite "exegesis". He stands on a high platform in this field and gives guidance to the country. In addition to explaining the exegesis, he also told us some tidbits, with a proud tone. He said that he would buy any new annotated version of the Songs of Chu that came out, look through it, and then throw it away because he didn't see anything new. At the same time, he would write to some annotators to express his congratulations, indicating that I have read your book, and also giving a hint: "If you use Guo Moruo and Wen Huaisha, you will specify it; in my explanation, I will use Even if you don’t tell me, I actually know it!” After saying this, he tightened his lips, tilted his head slightly, and raised his chin, leaving a freeze in my mind.

;

;——I then knew that for a scholar to be recognized, it requires a process of accumulation of qualifications. This gives me the peace of mind to face the same thing in the future.

;

;Teacher Guo Zaiyi was one of the most dazzling young scholars at that time. This also makes us very curious, how does he stand out?

;

;It is said that he was a "Xiaoyao sect" during the "Cultural Revolution". He brought books about "Chu Ci" from the reference room and read them one by one. His "Exegesis of Chu Ci" was written after reading hundreds of relevant materials. The obsession and fascination during this period can be evidenced by a story told by himself: Once when he went to buy meat, there was a long queue. He was holding a book and was fascinated. When he woke up, he found that it was dark and the market had already dispersed. , he was the only one, standing there reading for a long time. But at that time, "the more knowledge, the more reactionary". Reading these things only had negative effects, so many people laughed at him. An old classmate of his, who may or may not be inferior to him in terms of talent, but far surpasses him in terms of "shrewdness", actively participated in the "Cultural Revolution" and once dominated the world. After the "Cultural Revolution", he became one of the "three types of people" under inspection. When he returned to teaching, Guo Zaiyi had already shone in the academic world. Only then did he realize his past mistakes and start over. This led to a consensus that scholars should stay away from the “movement.” At the same time, there are also vague rumors that Teacher Guo is not in good health because he studies too hard.

;

;In the summer of 1985, after I graduated as a graduate student, I stayed at the school to teach. I was assigned a faculty dormitory and shared a room with my classmate Jin Xiaochun. Xiaochun’s graduation thesis was supervised by Teacher Guo. In the following year, I heard many stories from him about "our teacher Guo".

;

;First of all, I have a story related to Teacher Guo. In the autumn and winter of this year, Teacher He Chunhui and I went to Shanghai to deliver review materials for the promotion of teachers in our department, involving teachers such as Wu Xionghe, Cai Yijiang, Guo Zaiyi, and Ni Baoyuan. I am responsible for serving the experts in literature, and Chunhui is responsible for serving the experts in language and philology. She said that she was very enthusiastic when she met Mr. Shi Cunzhi from East China Normal University, and spoke highly of these teachers at Hangzhou University, especially Teacher Guo. I have participated in the promotion of several of my respected teachers to professional titles, and I feel quite "honored".

;

;Xiaochun got married before the Chinese New Year. His wife was from Hangzhou and her family was very well off. He moved to a new house and rarely came back. But when I come back, I always share the story of "our Teacher Guo" with me.

;

;In the spring and summer of 1986, because of his professional title promotion, Teacher Guo improved his salary and purchased some new furniture. He was in a very happy mood, playing with his newly purchased items for Xiaochun. Xiaochun and the teacher are both teachers and friends, and sometimes they deliberately quarrel with the teacher. I remember that Teacher Guo was proud of his newly bought double sofa, so Xiaochun said jokingly: My sofa is a three-person sofa! Teacher Guo was speechless for a moment and said, "Hey, I won't compare with you." He looked left and right, admiring it for himself, unable to contain his inner joy.

;

;Listening to Xiao Chundao telling such short stories, the common feeling in our hearts is one of indescribable bitterness. However, fortunately, all this will be a thing of the past, and the teacher’s vision has been filled with sunshine!

;

;In the fall of this year, I was admitted to Sun Yat-sen University to study for a Ph.D. Soon after, Xiaochun also went to the United States for academic exchange, and I rarely heard from Teacher Guo. More than two years later, in mid-January 1989, the news suddenly came that Teacher Guo Zaiyi had passed away. I was simply shocked! Is it fate? I have no words to say, I can only pray silently, may he be well in heaven.

;

;Many years later, I learned about Teacher Guo’s final condition from Zhang Yongquan’s article. On the afternoon when the B-ultrasound examination showed that he had liver cancer, Teacher Guo endured great mental pain and wrote a suicide note to his students:

;

;;Yongquan, Huang Zheng:;

;

;;Farewell in a hurry, extremely melancholy. You must work hard to complete our scientific research plan and strive to publish all three books to comfort my soul in heaven. ;

;

;;I have a favor for you:;

;

;;Please collect my articles that have not been included in the "Exegetical Series", compile a sequel, and try to publish it in a few years (of course it is impossible now), for I just want to earn some royalties to support my family, but I personally have nothing to ask for. ;

;

;;                zaiyi;

;

;;November 5, 1988;

;

;What a proud man, at that moment, he did not forget his " "Scientific research plan"; and for the sake of my family, I can only say humbly that I hope to "earn some royalties to support my family", but still declare: "I personally have nothing to ask for." After reading this "will", How can it not make people cry!

;

;Teacher Guo endured the pain and entered 1989, but in the end he was unable to save himself and passed away on January 10th. There is still one day left before his fiftieth birthday!

;

; I later read the memories written by Fu Jie: "In the last days of life, there are fewer and fewer words of Yi Master -both have no spirit and because of melancholy. Lying on the same way, the lost eyes did not look at us around us, just looked at the ceiling, and suddenly sobbed, making our young us Zhang emperor. "

;

; also confirmed the day of confirmation, He said to Yongquan: "The situation is not good, I have made thoughts, but pity their orphans and widows ..." But even two days before his death, he also said to Yongquan: "Fang Yizhi "Tongya" is a good book. If you come, buy one for me. "

;

; How nostalgia he is! Because he has too many things to do, there will be a plan of "Dunhuang Three Books" recently. It is implementing with his disciples. There is a pair of children who are still studying in middle school. Unwilling, but helplessness, and no one can say with the complaint, only the eyes of the loss of God only look at the ceiling "," more than once "," suddenly sobbing "...

;

; ;

;

; This photo, or the last summer, frowned slightly, without melancholy. ; (Guo Xianyu's picture/picture) ;

;

; Teacher Guo Zaiyi left the world, it is more than thirty years in a blink of an eye. This year is only eighty -four years old, but what kind of world will it open for the research of Chinese history! His classmates later accumulated and made their scores academically, and now they are healthy. If life can be selected again, how will people choose? Xia Chengzhang said to his friend Wang Jisi: "Ji Si, learning is not desperate by his life." However, life is alive, and he has nothing to do with the times and society. ;;核心职能，仍和土地相关;

;

;自然资源部约谈地市级政府负责人，与自然资源督察有关，这是上级政府对下级政府行政监察的形式之一。

;

;国家土地督察是国家自然资源督察的前身。为了遏制土地违法、落实耕地保护，2006年，国务院正式出台土地督察制度，主要督察对象为省、自治区、直辖市、计划单列市政府。

;

;2018年3月，自然资源部成立，“随着自然资源管理职能的转变，为适应自然资源管理需要”，国家土地督察转型为国家自然资源督察。

;

;2019年6月，中共中央办公厅、国务院办公厅发布《中央生态环境保护督察工作规定》，以党内法规形式明确了中央生态环境保护督察的制度构成、程序规范、权限责任等内容，同时确立了中央和省级两级督察体制。

;

;在武汉大学环境法研究所教授陈海嵩看来，即便自然资源部整合了多个部门的职能，但和土地相关的职能，仍是核心。 “自然资源的核心是土地资源”，陈海嵩说，因此，自然资源督察应该聚焦于最为成熟的土地督察业务，不断深入发展。

;

;2021年9月1日起施行的《土地管理法实施条例》则首次明确了自然资源督察的范围和工作方式。

;

;条例规定，国家自然资源督察机构根据授权对省（自治区、直辖市）人民政府以及国务院确定的城市人民政府的耕地保护情况、土地节约集约利用情况、国土空间规划编制和实施情况、国家有关土地管理重大决策落实情况、土地管理法律、行政法规执行情况、其他土地利用和土地管理情况等进行督察。

;

;国家自然资源督察机构还可以约谈被督察的地方人民政府有关负责人，并可以依法向监察机关、任免机关等有关机关提出追究相关责任人责任的建议。

;

;和此次9个市（州）长被叫到北京约谈不同，此前，国家自然资源督察机构的约谈大都在地方进行。

;

;2022年10月至11月，国家自然资源督察机构对31个省（自治区、直辖市）和新疆生产建设兵团开展了耕地保护和矿产资源实地督察，发现了一些违法违规问题.针对督察发现的突出问题，经国家自然资源总督察授权，派驻地方的国家自然资源督察机构对部分违法违规严重的地市政府进行约谈。

;

;其中，成都局约谈云南大理，北京局约谈河北邢台、山西晋中，南京局约谈江西九江，广州局约谈广东清远、广西南宁。

;

;此次在北京约谈地方政府主要负责人的深意，在陈海嵩看来，依然和粮食安全有关，“接下来很长一段时间内，耕地保护、粮食安全都是非常重要The problem".

;

;在约谈会上，国家自然资源专职副总督察陈尘肇表示：“耕地保护任务没有减轻，而是更加艰巨了。要采取坚决有力的措施，持续加强耕地保护，牢牢守住18亿亩耕地红线。”

;近期，一些地方中小学生“课间10分钟被约束”问题受到社会广泛关注，新华社“新华视点”记者就此采访了教育部有关负责同志。

;

;这位负责同志表示，中小学校安排课间休息十分重要、十分必要，有利于学生调节情绪、放松身心、增强体质和防控近视。 The Ministry of Education attaches great importance to students' recess. The "Regulations on the Protection of Minors in Schools" (Ministry of Education Order No. 50), which will be implemented on September 1, 2021, clearly states that legitimate exchanges between students during recess and other non-teaching time are not allowed. Unnecessary restrictions are placed on the freedom of speech and behavior such as games, activities outside the classroom, etc. In actual work, primary and secondary schools are required to arrange 30 minutes of physical activities between classes every day, and students should be arranged to go out of the classroom for appropriate activities and relaxation during each class break.

;

;这位负责同志指出，教育部将进一步督促地方和学校严格落实国家有关规定，遵循教育规律和学生身心发展规律，坚决纠正以“确保学生安全”为由而简单限制学生Necessary recess breaks and activities will be implemented; localities and schools will be guided to scientifically implement management and safety precautions, strengthen inspections of outdoor facilities and personnel on duty, strengthen students’ safety knowledge education, minimize the risk of safety accidents, and make children happy Activities with confidence. At the same time, schools will be required to work closely with home-school communities, strive for parents' understanding and social support, and work together to ensure students' normal activities during class and promote students' healthy growth and all-round development.
